results.byline: By Eduardo Medina, April Rubin and Neil Genzlinger
results.title: Kirstie Alley, Emmy-Winning ‘Cheers’ Actress, Dies at 71
results.abstract: A virtual unknown when she joined the cast of the hit sitcom in 1987, she became a star and a decade later had her own show, “Veronica’s Closet.”

media.caption: Kirstie Alley as the career-minded Rebecca Howe on the hit sitcom “Cheers.” She earned an Emmy Award and a Golden Globe for her portrayal.

results.title: Mysterious Object Emerges on a Florida Beach, Setting Off Speculation
results.abstract: The object appears to be about 80 feet long and made of wood and metal.

media.caption: Some theories about what is jutting out from the sand at Daytona Beach Shores are that it is a barrier, a shipwreck, a portion of an old pier, or spectator seating from when NASCAR had races on the beach.

results.title: ABC News Pulls Daytime Co-Anchors After Revelations of a Romance
results.abstract: T.J. Holmes and Amy Robach, who co-host “GMA3,” are temporarily off the air after a spate of tabloid reports.

media.caption: ABC News announced to staff members on Monday that the anchors T.J. Holmes, left, and Amy Robach had been pulled from the network’s daytime talk show, “GMA3.”

results.title: Judge in Trump Company Trial Knew How to Read the Numbers
results.abstract: Juan M. Merchan, who oversaw the tax fraud case against Donald J. Trump’s business, was an auditor at a real estate development company decades ago.

results.title: Michael Avenatti Gets 14-Year Sentence for Stealing Millions From Clients
results.abstract: The former lawyer for Stormy Daniels was found guilty of stealing money from four clients and of obstructing I.R.S. efforts to collect more than $3 million in unpaid payroll taxes.

media.caption: Michael Avenatti rose to national prominence in 2018 while representing the pornographic film actress Stormy Daniels in lawsuits against former President Donald J. Trump.

results.title: Ukraine Targets Bases Deep in Russia, Showing Expanded Reach

results.abstract: A detective relied on flawed information provided by the Find My app for a warrant that led the police to raid the home of a 77-year-old Denver woman, a lawsuit says.
